title: Shocking
content: The Devil's Advocate! Al Pacino and young Keanu Reeves come together to put on an absolute show! I first watched this movie on a night when I was seeking a good movie to watch. Oh my goodness,! It has an amazing story of morality and ethics. It also gets emotional as we see the main character's desperation and deep thought. It really holds your attention as the story unfolds and develops. Seeing Keanu Reeves in this role is great as well since it shows a different style of acting for him compared to some of his other roles in movies. For anyone looking for a nice psychological thriller and interesting story this movie is recommended.

title: Do you job good and you just might earn a ticket to hell
content: One quick look at the poster sets that chain of dominos off to the "wish-to-watch" button. Al Pacino luring with a charming smile, Keanu Reeves striking with a crispy-looking suit and Charlize Theron is as beautiful as always.Moving directly to the sale of Keanu's skills by means of a ruthless trial we see the motion towards a high throne entangled in the turbid mist of doubt that corrodes whatever righteous principles one can have. The attitude shown within Kevin Lomax deserves a high praise considering that the character undergoes the unhuman seduction by the inventor of this word himself. The part of Charlize Theron cannot be put aside; she spices this trial to the point of sweet tortures of consciousness that do the opposite of what she had intended. These mind and body games go deep beyond the simple fraud, they show the hidden nature of a person on a single example of a suburban lawyer.The other, magnificently breathtaking performance is standing out immediately and of course it is Al Pacino. Plainly saying this is just a role for which he was created. You look at the man and see that he could not only be a boss of a law firm but without any strain hold a faith of the world in his bare hands. The devilish subtlety that covers a sharp wit, aged appearance hiding the vigor of thousand men and the manner that cannot be rejected even by the holiest nun is a hallmark of Al Pacino.Besides the plot twists and stunning acting, we get ingenious editing and directing. I was blown away by the use of light, especially the fireplace scenes depicted that infernal atmosphere so inherent to the residents of hell. The mystic flair was scattered a bit by the fleeting visual effects: one of them was enchantingly impressive but the others were like mosquito bites - unpleasant but tolerable.The verdict is unanimous - the picture stands out and among all the suspense gives a valuable lesson in a way that astounds you.

title: The second greatest movie of all time
content: Simply remarkable... is all that can be said about this movie. If Al Pacino's acting which is utterly flawless in this tale does not grab you, then the deft writing will. The true grit and meaning behind this movie being that, evil is subtle and deceiving and comes when never expect it, was delivered in a way that no one else in Hollywood has ever done. Al Pacino's monologues about his edge of Reeve's in that people never see him coming is near flawless. His character is believable in its fullest. This movie is beautifully written, and the acting is above average, I recommend watching it again and again and think about the messages buried in the richness of this movie and applying it to your life.

title: Makes you realize how good an actor Al Pacino really is.
content: How many actors are there who could play Satan to such perfection? Al Pacino does no less than a superb job portraying John Milton, a man of power, women and money living in a world with no guilt. A great moment in cinema when he makes his final speech to Kevin Lomax (Keanu Reeves). But his acting only the icing on the cake of a brilliant film. The script also deserves mention for portraying the devil not as a bloodthirsty monster but as a being of temptation and desire. While not really being a drama but not really being a thriller either, you truly feel for the characters but are put on the edge of your seat at the same time, the second half of this movie will hold you in constant suspense. The nudity and violence are a bit gratuitous but never for their own sake, everything you see is there for the movie, any less and it wouldn't have worked as well.Overall a fantastic film and a must see for all thriller fans and all drama fans. You won't be disappointed.

title: The Devil's Advocate takes its time burning out.
content: Not that he needed to but Taylor Hackford more than confirms he is no Roman Polanski in this slick modern day Gothic horror that in the course of its healthy running time (144 minutes) becomes one to endure. Poorly paced, over and under acted this slick looking bore grows more incredulous with each reel as the characters lose steam with Hackford desperately tries to inject some shock value ( a demented Charlize Theron going topless in a church being one of his grander flourishes) into this supernatural snorer.Florida counselor Kevin Lomax has all the tools to make him a superb defense lawyer. When he gets the call to go to work for a firm in the majors he jumps at it. Moving to the Big Apple he joins the firm of John Milton (Al Pacino) whose piercing intensity Lomax finds both motivating and intimidating. He begins to prove himself fast and is given some big assignments over senior staff. Career wise things are going great but at home wife Mary Ann (Theron) is starting to deconstruct and there is strong suspicion Milton has something to do with it.With the wooden Reaves in the lead Advocate is sore in need of one as he feigns confusion at the most obvious of ploys put forth by the evil Milton. For a guy that's supposed to be a sharp lawyer he spends an awful amount of the films running time oblivious to Hackford's heavy handed red flags. Pacino's sartorially attired Beelzebub is all wide eyed sadist and smugness with runway models replacing Gog and Magog as companions. Oozing unctuous charm and calm he toys with Lomax longer than a cat with a chipmunk and it's just about as entertaining. Theron fairs the best among the leads by tamping down her share of the hysteria but by the time Devil's Advocate arrives at its climax it has already gone to hell.

title: Big Time Stinker.....Don't Waste Your Time
content: Without a doubt one of the dumbest movies I have ever had the misfortune to see.  Only thing more offensive than the idiotic storyline, gratuitous nudity/sex, & excruciatingly slow pace was the sight of all that money up on the screen (Pacino, Reeves, monstrously luxurious sets) being wasted. After the first 20 minutes, I was ready to turn the damn thing off.  I managed to stick it out for another hour before I resorted to the fast forward button.  How could actors of Pacino & Reeves' calibre be sucked into something this bad?  At least Pacino looked like he was enjoying himself; Reeves' continual expression could only be interpreted as "what the hell am I doing in this lame-ass movie?"  And the ending...!  Well, suffice it to say that we've all seen it before---on "Dallas" & other low-rent t.v. shows. Dumb, dumb, dumb.  This movie's worst sin?---it's not even entertaining.

title: The Sixth Deadly Sin
content: "Hotshot attorney Kevin Lomax's 64-0 case record has brought him a tempting offer from an elite New York firm. But the job Lomax accepts isn't what it seems. The Devil is in the details. In this gleeful, modern Gothic fable, Keanu Reeves plays eager Lomax and Al Pacino is the charismatic firm founder who knows there are cases to be wonÂ and souls to be lost. From Lomax's court triumphs and skyrocket rise to its double-twist ending, 'The Devil's Advocate' is red-hot entertainment. Lomax's life, wife (Charlize Theron) and soul are on the line. He's landed a job that's Heaven on EarthÂ which can led him straight to Hell," according to the official synopsis.Director Taylor Hackford's film is beautifully shot, but the story is ham-fisted and cheesy. The first thing that made me wonder: How is it that attorney Reeves, after a string of 64 cases in the courtroom, is dumbfounded by the fact that his opening client MIGHT be guilty? This is not at all plausible. But, the opening events are much more realistic than the entirety of "Act III" (before the ending reversal); and, it's nicely performed. After building to a jumpy midpoint, "The Devil's Advocate" becomes unintentionally funny. On the plus side, Charlize Theron (as Mary Ann Lomax) and Connie Nielsen (as Christabella Andreoli) are scrumptiously sexy. Ah, vanity...***** The Devil's Advocate (10/17/97) Taylor Hackford ~ Keanu Reeves, Al Pacino, Charlize Theron

title: A terrific
content: A terrific film. Everything is intertwined - detective, melodrama, mysticism, horror and even erotica. All this in one bottle mixed director Taylor Hackford. But, if his name is not too well known, then the names of the actors are just a list of world stars: Al Pacino, Charlize Theron, and, of course, Keanu Reeves. It is he in the title role - the lawyer Kevin Lomax. A successful young lawyer is invited to New York, to a reputable firm. But is everything in it so according to the law, are all the affairs of this office so clean? The wife of a young lawyer and his mother begin to sense the danger. But who is the biggest enemy?The storyline is very dynamic, the script spring is constantly twisting. The ending is very dramatic and unexpected.Great movie, you can watch it over and over again.

title: Every success has its price!
content: Every time I think of all the great things I am going to do to get my career going, be competitive, show the world, etc. I am reminded of this movie which very carefully shows us what could be the price of going for it a little bit too much.It is important to strive for success, the fast track, and to get to the top but we should always remember that the higher we get, the harder we are likely to fall.And the price to get there cannot be obtained, or rather shouldn't be obtained, by selling our souls!

title: Riiiiight.
content: Okay, see, this movie, it's got Keanu Reeves playing a highly successful, very smart attorney working for some kind of firm.  If you can get past that (which is no easy task, as Keanu isn't the ::: cough ::: greatest actor), you'll realize it tries to play off as an intelligent thriller.  Make no mistake, it's not.  I wasn't exactly paying attention at the beginning, so there's a miniscule chance I missed something, but I doubt it, as there's really nothing to this movie.  Okay, yeah, you've got Keanu playing nancy-boy, and he does some work, goes a little south on his morale, and realizes his boss is Satan.  How many times have I had this realization? Yeah.  Pretty intriguing, no?  Perhaps if this had been better written, the sets had been a little better, not so overwhelming, maybe this would have worked.  Al Pacino played every character he's played since Michael Corleone, oftentimes yelling at spontaneous moments, and not always making sense.  Okay, yeah.  The fatal flaw in this film is that the quality of it seesaws on the ending.  For maybe a minute (and all of you know what a long minute it was, as it stretched on and on in a senseless slow motion portion) this movie was one of the coolest I've ever seen.  But then, the laziness of the writers broke through, and you're disappointed.  All the same, I'll say that if you turn it off at that moment, folks, you're looking at a grand film.  Time it right, and you've got a great movie.  You'll know when.

title: Exposing women to evil is an easy way of raising the audience's emotions
content: A most pleasing surprise! Since I haven't heard very much about it, I assumed it to be just another thriller. I was wrong. I think it succeeds very much in creating an ever escalating anguish with the audience, the evil just get worse and worse. Of course, subjecting women (especially someone's love) to all kinds of evil is a rather easy way to create compassion for the victims and hatred against the villain - in this case the excellent Al Pacino as Milton aka Satan. However, it is done so with great care and thoroughness, to the extent that you cannot help but find yourself intrigued by what is happening and what will happen next. Of course, the many beautiful women of the movie are a strong factor of getting a man's attention...

title: The Lord of Underworld
content: Primarily taken for a crisp horror show for New York lawyers of the 90's, this flick is too underrated. Probably because of the flirting of movie industry with high end dramas or "lethal weapon" type of action, so much so that people forget the supreme acting of some of the most excellent Hollywood actors of our time, in their prime.But lets delve into the world of biased lawership of the South and the fast paced world of New York legal arena, where we meet the top lawyers of a firm right out of John Grishams best. Al Pacino, does his best Scarfae and Godfathger into a mayhem of superb acting that just captivates your mind from minute to minute. The plot is beautiful and masterfully paced between handling cases in the middle of a metropolis clash of businessmen and dirty minded partners, while the young gun of Keanu Reeves arrives with his Charlize and just goes ballistic into the money made for big time law firms and calculating every "fee" as much as a devils own party would in the most complex environment to handle - the New York law firm cutthroat partnership of lawyers and evils living side by side. Keanu Reeves shines very well in roles where he is fighting for his life and trying to dis ensemble the twisted schemes of the more experienced lawyers at this firm, but cant quite make it in their level of evil. Unless, he has to deal with "the devil" himself and his sisters trying to control the world. Just as any high end law firm should if the money is right.The drama develops very well into the second half which turns into real mayhem and the end which gets even "worse". Charlize Theron is as beautiful as ever and Keanu us mother does her part to give it a side story of horror ambiance, which also gets it into the movie genre that Pacino prefers and shines on. Although just a tiny bit rough on the edges and utterly cynical at times, this movie is a wonderful piece of film.

title: Dynamic Performance
content: I have seen this movie approximately 20 times, yes 20 times, and none of the luster has worn off.  Al Pacino is at his best with a convincing portrayal as the devil in disguise.  The balance of the cast, especially Charlize Theron, handled the supporting roles in classic fashion.  The ending of the movie had more twists and turns than the Indianapolis 500 Speedway. Pacino is masterful and his in-your-face analysis of power-hungry achievers makes you wonder if this is fiction or reality.  The special effects are incomparable. A must see.

title: Surprisingly interesting
content: Let's find out how devil and being an attorney are linked.Story: attorney ending up to work for the devil!!! It's interesting to see how the plot started and twisted. The characters are very well written. The conflict between a hard job and family, being ambitious and dedicated to your goals and personal life. Talented Al Pacino weaving a trap to Reeves in order to take a certain decision in combination to the concept of free will. Of course, Theron's role as the attorney's wife was fascinating.Acting: Wonderful Al Pacino, very good Theron, adequate Reeves.Recommended!!!

title: Awful film.
content: This film is absolutely ridiculously. No wonder, Taylor Hackford was at the helm. The plot is hard to swallow, as much as is Keanu Reeves' acting. Good to see Charlize Theron was nominated - what as a supporting actress by the Saturn Awards? Is this a horror film, or a take on justice? Lawyers have to uphold the rights of their clients, to burden them with the results of their trials and send them to hell is a bit of a stretch. Milton, played to the hilt by Pacino who has to make use of some bad screenwriting, harks back to "And Justice for All" where we also see the same issues portrayed in a clearer manner, thanks to Norman Jewison. Funny that Craig T. Nelson was in that film as well, this time playing D. A.If this is an Exorcist, it is not a good one. The idea that Milton's character is responsible for the pitfalls of the 20th century is laughable.And if this is truly NYC, people were not smoking in cocktail lounges and soirÃ©es with Alonso D'Amato in 1997.

title: How hard must one try to impress the new boss, Satan himself?
content: A young attorney(Keanu Reeves)with a flawless track record is hired by one of the world's most successful law firms. The organization is run by Satan on earth(Al Pacino). This movie contains elements of decadence, money worship, womanizing, the thrill of power and living without an ounce of guilt. Almost two and a half hours long seems like forever. Tension gets thick enough to club with a 2 by 4.Charlize Theron is beautiful as ever. And proves she can act too. Also featured are Craig T. Nelson, Debra Monk, Connie Nielsen and Jeffrey Jones.

title: A good movie
content: A good movie starring Keanu Reeves and El Pacino Charlize Theron. It also tells the wonderful story of Satan and the fall of man through sin. The only downside to the film was its special effects, which you now enjoy less than 25 years later.

title: My thoughts after I saw this movie.
content: Besides all, I think God really likes to watch ... at all of us.

title: thought provoking...excellent
content: Can enough be said about Al Pachino?  Excellent acting...for previous skeptics of Keanu Reeves' acting abilities, this should serve to calm your doubts.  All this, an intriguing storyline, intense special effects, and enough food for thought to keep The Devil's Advocate at the top of my mind for 2 days after viewing.

title: Complex, clever law career film with a twist
content: I've missed seeing this film a couple of times but chose it in favour of Good Will Hunting last night.Excellent, gripping, well written with capable acting.In most thrillers one is inundated with gore and 'plastic' CGIs, this film is far more skillfully constructed than the normal pap.The characters may not be brilliantly formed and Al Pachino was basically playing as the character in Scent of a Woman but I throughly enjoyed this film and would recommend it for good Sunday, Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, etc. night viewing.Nice one.

title: "For we wrestle not against flesh and blood..."
content: I had been aware of the basic premise behind this film for a long time and seen a clip here or there. Al Pacino plays the devil, etc., yada yada. Seeing everything in context and in its entirety was something else. The mastery of pacing, tone, the little glimpses you get along the way, knowing what's coming at the end of the journey (or at least thinking you do). This grabs you from the first scene and never lets go. And the way things evolve and develop makes this like the cinematic version of erotic asphyxiation (or so I'd like to think). Everything was on point, and ever so thematically relevant. The only real quibble I have is that Keanu Reeves wasn't quite up to the most dramatic scenes. Everything else was *chef's kiss*. And Al Pacino, aside from a couple recent films, delivered his last genuinely great mega-performance. Once he finally let loose in the finale, whoo boy! The visual effects and the score were also quite good, haunting even. And Charlize Theron and Connie Nielsen at peak hotness, have mercy! (Been watching a lot of Full House lately) To sum up, this was an amazing cinematic experience, even if it wasn't presenting something particularly deep or perceptive.

title: Brilliant
content: Al Pacino and Keanu Reeves make this movie unforgettable with their wonderful acting, they portray their characters unbelievably good. The movie's plot is exciting and thrilling. The whole movie very well-written, the ending is fantastic. Everyone must watch this movie at least once.

title: incredible performances from Pacino and Reeves, compelling and disturbing and guiltily pleasing
content: It's shocking that Al Pacino almost passed on this role. When you watch it, it's like he was born to portray the devil but only in how it was written in this movie. Regardless of your religious beliefs, one can enjoy this movie as a piece of fiction as well as an ethical character study. Emotionally charged and visually disturbing, this is a flick that has me in awe of the performances, script, and even smiling with marvelous disbelief at Pacino's delivery. Possibly my favorite Keanu Reeves role, as big of a Matrix fan as I am. Charlize Theron also did spectacularly, and warrants the most emotional scene in the movie for me. The ending couldn't be more perfect, and I'm all applause.

title: Vanity, definitely my favorite sin
content: The Devil's Advocate stands at a peak that is hard to reach in terms of acting and script. Such a devilish film could only have been made this good without the horror elements. The Devil's Advocate is a gripping, thought-provoking thriller that blends legal drama with supernatural intrigue. Keanu Reeves delivers a strong performance as a young, ambitious attorney who is lured into the morally corrupt world of his charismatic boss, played by Al Pacino. Pacino shines in a mesmerizing, devilish role, adding layers of tension and intrigue. The film masterfully explores themes of temptation, power, and the price of ambition, with sharp direction and a twisting narrative that keeps viewers on edge until the final moments. It's a smart, stylish blend of drama and suspense that lingers long after the credits roll. The dialogues are very well described. I don't know if there is anyone who doesn't admire Al Pacino's acting after watching this film.

title: This Is Such A Silly Movie
content: The Devil's Advocate is utter pants. I wouldn't waste my time explaining the plot but it has to be one of the silliest horror movies ever made. It is a sheer letdown typified by Pacino's over-the-top and overdone performance and Reeves annoying southern accent and a narrative so ridiculous it is laughable. Then again, Reeves has never been that good of an actor himself anyway, if his previous roles are anything to go by. Charlize Theron is type-casted as the blonde bombshell and victim of distress and whilst I have seen better performances from her in this film, she is nothing more than male eye candy and thus, what else? Rather that she turns up in one scene in the nude. Likewise, the ending is just laughable and terrible. This film is total rubbish.

title: The Devil comes in all shapes and forms
content: This Movie is a Masterpiece, it's great all through, but the last 30min of Al Pacino's speech and Performance as Devil himself is one of the best in Movie History , I still got goosebumps from that, what an act. All Actors are great but Al Pacinos Performance knocks it out of the Park. This Film reflects today's Society, and no change in sight. Movie also aged well the small amount of cgi doesn't look to bad for a movie that is 25 years old. What else can I say, other then watch it if you still don't have. It's a all time Classic for me.-- I still have 54 characters left so just ignore this --

title: Keanu Reeves lawyer and the devil
content: The movie at times seemed long but I was happy with the result and I would highly recommend this movie!

title: hamzkse
content: In "The Devil's Advocate," lawyers tackle tricky decisions. Al Pacino, a persuasive but shady character, and Keanu Reeves, a lawyer facing a tough situation, lead the story. Mixing law with some supernatural twists adds intrigue. The movie prompts reflection on morality, making it engaging for all audiences. Despite not being a law buff, the suspense and stellar acting make it an intriguing watch. The blurred lines between right and wrong create a captivating narrative, leaving viewers pondering the consequences of ambitious choices. With its gripping storyline, this film is a compelling exploration of ethical dilemmas and success's hefty price.

title: Good piece to watch and learn
content: Vanity drives to insanity and insanity to self-destruction. Why can't we still behave!It's us who needs to rectify and listen to our pure instincts.May God bless us.

title: The Devil's Advocate Review
content:
What is this movie bad from the worst movies Keanu Reeves and Al Pacino After one hour of the movie, the movie became bored bad to normal, there was nothing that pulled me in the movie. The acting was normal. The story was very, very ordinary.
The movie I didn't like until the last hour of the movie, I couldn't see it. It is one of the worst films of Keanu Reeves and Al Pacino.

title: Pacino is always great
content: Anyone that likes Pacino must see this one, and you can't watch it just once.  You will pick up on much more the second time.  I don't think there is another actor that could have played the part any better.

title: Vanity! My favourite sin..
content: Kevin receives a tempting proposition from a prestigious law firm located in New York, prompting him to relocate to the bustling city alongside his wife. As he immerses himself in his demanding job, his wife starts experiencing unsettling visions and nightmares, causing a strain on their relationship and her mental well-being. The once exciting move to the big city now seems to be taking a toll on their lives in unexpected ways, leaving Kevin torn between his career aspirations and his wife's deteriorating mental state.This film features a plot that is slightly twisted but engaging, starting strong, faltering in the middle, and then gaining momentum towards the end. It delivers a profound message about redemption and taking opportunities to make amends. In general, it is a worthwhile watch for viewers interested in a well-crafted film with a complex storyline.

title: The Devil as a firm executive!
content: This film would have been much better without the introduction of the devil as a person and just concentrate in plain common human evil. Then the characters would've been more real and trustworthy and the film would've gain from it because then they would've had no specialization to be identified with. Like, Al Pacino has the role of the devil and acts like one as everyone is expecting, he is the devil and therefore he is evil, there is no surprise in that. But if he would've been a human being (an evil one), that would've been surprising and much more effective to the plot. And then the film would've jump up from horror to drama, a much better account from my point of view. It's a pity it was not like that, because otherwise the acting and directing was superb, but there is always the possibility of making a new film......

title: The Devil is a friend of mine. Or is he?
content: Great movie, a bit predictable, but high quality. Basicly all about what happens if you go along side with the Devil.

title: "Paradise Lost" John Milton
content: Look past the acres of flesh and the history of Keanu Reeves and his bad-acting, look past the idea of this is how Charlize Theron got noticed, just sit and watch a masterpiece. Keanu Reeves put's in a surprisingly good performance, Charlize Theron does brilliantly but the true gem is the master, Al Pacino, who steals every single scene he's in and nearly steals the ones he's not in because of how brilliant he actually is. It's just too bad that Al Pacino has put in so many brilliant performances and the one he get's an Oscar or whatever in is just about him being blind. He is truly great in masterpieces that aren't recognised by the industry giants. This movie also has a brilliant ending, and a true brilliant ending is one where it isn't spelled out for you, but you can think it over, like this one.

title: Keanu Reeves and Al Pacino... enough said
content: A very ahead of its time movie and one of the classics. Perhaps one of Keanu Reeves' and Al Pacino's finest acting in any movies ever. Ending was on point too, music was biblically convenient to the theme of the movie. The reason I can't give it 5 stars though is that I didn't quite find myself enjoying it THAT much, but still.Some things I liked about "The Devil's Advocate":It was unique. I have (personally) never seen a movie with this type of plot before, which made this quite an unique experience for me, and not a bad experience either.The acting. Like I said, Keanu Reeves was surprisingly good in this, and of course Al Pacino too, but what is that guy not good in? He's a legend at this point.And lastly, the score was very convenient to the theme of the movie. But since it wasn't perfect by any means, i'll stick with a 8 stars rating.

title: Well worth the time.
content: This is a well-done movie with an interesting story line and some unusual, difficult to predict, twists at the end. Pacino is generally superb and quite believable, though his script is a bit weak at times. The supporting actors are capable, though not spectacular. Special effects are sparsely, yet effectively, used. All in all, an enjoyable couple of hours for most horror/thriller movie buffs.
